question_text: Which configuration would maximize bandwidth between the CPU and memory in a high-performance desktop system?
answer_options: Two unmatched DDR4 modules in any two slots
A single DDR5 module running at maximum MT/s
Four matched DDR4 modules installed in correct colored slot pairs
One high-capacity ECC module placed in the first slot
correct_answer: Four matched DDR4 modules installed in correct colored slot pairs
explanation: Matched memory modules installed in appropriate slots enable multi-channel operation, which increases memory bandwidth significantly.
